## Short bio

Hello! ğŸ‘‹

I am Stelios, or Stylianos, as my ID insists. I graduated - survived from the [Department of Statistics and Insurance Science](https://www.unipi.gr/en/department-of-statistics-and-insurance-science/), completing all 47 courses. Even though I didnâ€™t receive the legendary [A38 certificate](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Passierschein_A38), I did get my completion certificate, and I am moving forward!

I have a strong passion for data analysis, machine learning, and more recently, deep learning. Right now, I am looking for my first job in Statistics or Data Science, either in a Junior position or through an internship. No matter when this small miracle happens, I will be here doing what I love. Until recently, I was heavily focused on R, but since I need to find a job, I have started learning Python more systematically. During my studies, I completed many assignments using LaTeX, which is a tool similar to Word but mainly used for work with heavy mathematical and statistical notation. In addition, in my free time, I enjoy creating various visualizations, writing analysis articles, and building statistical web applications like dashboards and ML apps. Many of these can be found on my website.

Happy reading!

## About this website

My first attempt at creating a website was in 2022, using [Distill](https://rstudio.github.io/distill/), a popular R package that makes it easy to build a simple website. As you might expect, it was widely used by those familiar with R. Around the same time, Quarto was released, and I switched to it a few months later. Since then, Iâ€™ve been using Quarto exclusively for my website.

One important addition worth mentioning is the babelquarto package, which enables the website to support two languages (Greek and English). Because of the bilingual setup, I needed to choose a font that supports both Greek and English characters so that switching languages wouldnâ€™t affect the typography. Thatâ€™s why I use [Gentium Plus](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Gentium+Plus) throughout the website.

During the first year of my websiteâ€™s operation, I used the free domain provided by GitHub, which was *stesiam.github.io*. Some older content, especially in the gallery collection, still references this original domain in diagrams from 2022. In 2023, I decided to give the website a more professional identity by purchasing my current domain name. Since the beginning, the site has been hosted for free through GitHub Pages.
